nodes.bodyText: Too much information about the underlying implementation is spilled over to the Authenticator. This makes the Authenticator fragile. In the case a different approach to represent JWT is chosen, Authenticator would have to be changed. Consider creating another layer of abstraction. You can either make JWTInfoDto an entity class by adding JWT related methods, or create a new class for handling JWT related stuff.
These methods too should go into a different entity class, rather than into a Util method. Now the GatewayUtil is coupled with the implementation of the JWT.
Improper use of exceptions. This is going to cause performance issues down the line. Better replace it with a logic that checks validity.
